message: In particular there was one that showed the function/class I'm in at all times in the status bar. I haven't been able to fish that one out again.
In answer to myself: python.vim http://www.vim.org/scripts/script.php?script_id=30 is what I had in mind. Haven't taken advantage of the shortcuts yet, actually
and thanks to @ptone just found pyflakes.vim http://www.vim.org/scripts/script.php?script_id=2441 which I would characterize as : tremendous
You should try ropevim (http://rope.sourceforge.net/ropevim.html) for refactorings, code-browsing and some other tools.
there is also the old taglist plugin (http://www.vim.org/scripts/script.php?script_id=273), which works fairly well, but in a separate pane, not the statusline.

@ethanmiller even better than pyflakes.vim is syntastic (which uses pyflakes among others) https://github.com/scrooloose/syntastic, It works much better and can handle unicode characters, which pyflakes.vim cannot.
If you are using py.test to run your tests you should look at pytest.vim too: https://github.com/alfredodeza/pytest.vim
@ethanmiller I have to disagree, that plugin is unmaintained and old. I presented a new one with way better support for Python called chapa.vim at PyCon http://pycon.blip.tv/file/4884752/
@ethanmiller you can find the actual plugin download here: http://www.vim.org/scripts/script.php?script_id=3395 and the project lives in Github: https://github.com/alfredodeza/chapa.vim
@alfredodeza Does chapa correctly handle nested functions/classes?
@dwf no, it currently can't tell if you are nesting functions :( Hopefully I can get a handle in that in a next release
